snippet: Stocks climbed to new heights in part on rosy retail sales data, pushing the broad market to levels last seen in June 2008 and the Nasdaq composite index past the 3,000 milestone for the first time since 2000.
abstract: Stocks climb on strong retail sales data, pushing the broad market to levels last seen in June 2008; Nasdaq composite index closes at 3,039.88, first time since 2000 that it finishes over 3,000, when the Internet bubble burst and the index plummeted nearly 40 percent.

headline.main: Nasdaq Finishes Above 3,000, Its Best Since Dot-Com Bubble
headline.print_headline: Nasdaq Finishes Above 3,000, Its Best Since Dot-Com Bubble

snippet: Also, Marie Colvin is laid to rest and an interview with Apple's style guru.
abstract: Also, Marie Colvin is laid to rest and an interview with Apple's style guru.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Rebekah Brooks Arrested and Wi-Fi via the Homeless

snippet: Corrections appearing in print on March 13, 2012.
Trying to entice travelers in their 20s to mid-30s, the fastest-growing age segment, many owners and operators are remodeling existing hotels or introducing new ones.
abstract: Many hotel owners and operators, trying to entice the fastest-growing age segment, travelers in their 20s to mid-30s, are remodeling existing hotels or introducing new ones; many of the technology- and social media-obsessed Millennials seek innovative attractions, including free Wi-Fi and stylish bars.

snippet: China reported its biggest trade deficit in at least 22 years, and investors paused to consider the impact of a slowing Chinese economy.
abstract: Stocks are mixed in light trading as investors pause to consider the impact of a slowing Chinese economy.

headline.main: Slowdown in China Weighs on Wall St.
headline.print_headline: Slowdown in China Weighs on Wall St.

snippet: The Media Equation column on Monday, about efforts to set standards for online content aggregation, misstated a point in an Advertising Age column by Simon Dumenco that was widely picked up by other Web sites, and misstated the timing of its publi...

Federal regulators are close to bringing cases against two brokerage firms that trade stocks of privately held companies, the first legal actions resulting from a yearlong investigation into the buying and selling of shares of closely held Interne...
abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission is bringing civil charges against Felix Investments and is nearing a settlement with SharesPost; they are the first legal actions resulting from a yearlong investigation into the buying and selling of shares of closely held Internet start-ups. (M)

headline.main: S.E.C. Query Closes In On 2 Brokerage Firms

byline.original: By PETER LATTMAN and EVELYN M. RUSLI
